content.webTitle: Cricket: County Championship guide First Division – Durham

fields.headline: County Championship preview: Durham
fields.bodyText: Big year for Ian Blackwell His left-arm slows and leg-side biffs should strengthen his new team's one-day cricket. In a nutshell Will Smith has a hard act to follow after taking over the captaincy from Dale Benkenstein, who stood down after leading Durham to the championship. Even if Steve Harmison recovers England's affections, their seam bowling resources are strong Ashes factor Not for the first time, Harmison returns from an England tour in need of rehabilitation in the north-east Foreign flavour David Warner is hugely interesting. He is the only player selected for Australia (at Twenty20) without playing a State match, is ambidextrous with the bat and bowls both off-spin and leg-spin Well I never Will Smith has taken a journalism course so the post-match press conferences should pose few problems David Hopps Bob Willis's verdict The defending champions should go very well again this season. Blackwell was a good acquisition and in Shivnarine Chanderpaul they have the world's leading Test batsman. They have a superb collection of seam bowlers and I don't think anyone will have a stronger attack than them. Should finish in the top three Captain Will Smith Coach Geoff Cook 2008: Championship Champions (D1) Pro40 3rd (D1) Friends Provident semi-finals Twenty 20 Cup semi-finals In Ian Blackwell (Som) Out Garry Park (Der), Gary Scott (released) Overseas David Warner (Aus, for Twenty20), Shivnarine Chanderpaul (WI, from mid-June)
